articles.headline: The Hot Issue Bedeviling Arizona’s New Governor: Tamales
articles.snippet: Gov. Katie Hobbs vetoed a bill that would have allowed an informal network of home cooks to sell perishable food legally. The backlash has been fierce.
articles.abstract: Gov. Katie Hobbs vetoed a bill that would have allowed an informal network of home cooks to sell perishable food legally. The backlash has been fierce.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX — Milagros Cruz was down to her last $75, and sleeping in a car, when she heard her mother’s voice guiding her in a dream: My girl, make tamales.

articles.headline: Alphabet Shrugs Off Advertising Slump, Thanks to Search Engine
articles.snippet: Google’s parent company returned to sales growth, even as an advertising slowdown continued to crimp YouTube.
articles.abstract: Google’s parent company returned to sales growth, even as an advertising slowdown continued to crimp YouTube.
articles.lead_paragraph: After years of easy financial growth and booming popularity, Alphabet, Google’s parent company, has in recent months faced mounting questions about its future. It has been under the gun to deliver artificial intelligence technology, its sales growth has decelerated, and it is laying off 12,000 employees to cut costs.

articles.headline: Ad Flap Leaves Bitter Aftertaste for Bud Light and Warning for Big Business
articles.snippet: Bud Light’s marketing effort with a transgender influencer has put it “in the center of the culture wars in a way that no company could possibly want to be,” one observer said.
articles.abstract: Bud Light’s marketing effort with a transgender influencer has put it “in the center of the culture wars in a way that no company could possibly want to be,” one observer said.
articles.lead_paragraph: When she was named Anheuser-Busch’s marketing vice president, Alissa Heinerscheid explained in a recent podcast interview, “I had this super clear mandate: We need to evolve and elevate this incredibly iconic brand.” Doing that, she said, “means having a campaign that’s truly inclusive.”

articles.headline: Binance Faces Mounting Pressure as U.S. Crypto Crackdown Intensifies
articles.snippet: The scrutiny on Binance, the giant cryptocurrency exchange, has sent new tremors through a market that is still bruised by the implosion of FTX.
articles.abstract: The scrutiny on Binance, the giant cryptocurrency exchange, has sent new tremors through a market that is still bruised by the implosion of FTX.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, the giant cryptocurrency exchange Binance has had a reputation for dodging regulators and skirting financial rules, all without significant consequences.
articles.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany, Emily Flitter and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: U.K. Blocks Microsoft’s $69 Billion Bid for Activision, a Blow for Tech Deals
articles.snippet: The decision barring the takeover of a big video game publisher is a major victory for proponents of regulating tech giants, which have faced obstacles in the United States.
articles.abstract: The decision barring the takeover of a big video game publisher is a major victory for proponents of regulating tech giants, which have faced obstacles in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: British antitrust regulators dealt a major setback on Wednesday to Microsoft’s plans to acquire the video game giant Activision Blizzard for $69 billion, blocking the proposed deal and handing a notable win to government enforcers around the world who want to rein in Big Tech.
articles.byline: By David McCabe and Kellen Browning

articles.headline: House G.O.P. Passes Debt Limit Bill, Paving the Way for a Clash With Biden
articles.snippet: House Republicans narrowly passed a bill to raise the debt ceiling while cutting spending by nearly 14 percent over a decade. President Biden has vowed to veto the measure.
articles.abstract: House Republicans narrowly passed a bill to raise the debt ceiling while cutting spending by nearly 14 percent over a decade. President Biden has vowed to veto the measure.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House on Wednesday narrowly passed Republicans’ bill to raise the debt ceiling while cutting spending and unraveling major elements of President Biden’s domestic agenda, in a G.O.P. bid to force Mr. Biden to negotiate over spending reductions or risk a catastrophic debt default.
articles.byline: By Catie Edmondson and Carl Hulse

articles.headline: In an Indian Village, Cultivating Girls’ Big-League Dreams
articles.snippet: A new $500 million women’s cricket league is offering the kind of opportunities that never existed before in India. The girls of one Punjab village are ready.
articles.abstract: A new $500 million women’s cricket league is offering the kind of opportunities that never existed before in India. The girls of one Punjab village are ready.
articles.lead_paragraph: The girls arrive at the makeshift cricket ground on their bicycles, a narrow file of white athletic uniforms breezing down a dirt track that cuts through lush wheat fields in India’s Punjab region. They wear their names and numbers on their backs, their hair tied in long, neat braids. The youngest is 9, the oldest 14.
articles.byline: By Mujib Mashal and Atul Loke

articles.headline: Disney Sues DeSantis Over Control of Its Florida Resort
articles.snippet: The company claimed “a targeted campaign of government retaliation,” which it said stemmed from its criticism of a contentious state education law.
articles.abstract: The company claimed “a targeted campaign of government retaliation,” which it said stemmed from its criticism of a contentious state education law.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last year, under pressure from its employees, Disney criticized a Florida education law prohibiting classroom discussion of sexual orientation and gender identity for young students. Almost instantly, Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida started calling the company “Woke Disney” and vowing to show it who was boss.
